meanings.sent1: She misdeemed his intentions and thought he was being rude.
meanings.sent2: The teacher misdeemed the student's answer as incorrect, but it was actually right.
meanings.sent3: Despite misdeeming the situation, they all ended up having a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her misdeemed perception of reality shattered when she learned the truth.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misdeeming others can be harmful and unfair.

meanings.definition: To have an incorrect opinion or belief about something.
meanings.sent1: He misdeemed the new movie to be boring, but it turned out to be his favorite.
meanings.sent2: They misdeemed her to be shy, but she was actually very outgoing.
meanings.sent3: The cat misdeemed the cucumber as a snake and jumped in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The misdeemed rumors spread like wildfire through the small town.
meanings.sent5: Misdeeming the weather forecast, he left his umbrella at home and got soaked.
